p:
Table 1 shows the regression root-mean-square error (RMSE) of all methods on 14 datasets. RBF was the top performing method in 13 and the second best performing method in 1. In the case (
Housing ) in which RBF was not the best method, the difference between RBF and the top performing method (RF) was within 2%. RF was the second best performing among the regression datasets. RBFâ€™s performance exhibited the greatest improvement over that of the other methods with the
3D Road Network dataset, a shallow task in which the methods predicted the altitude at specific points on a 3D map. However, RBF outperformed RF by allowing non-axis-parallel splitting.
